summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 regarding the logistics for FBI agents to facilitate Ghislaine Maxwell's review of sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It details scheduling, personnel assignments, and strict instructions not to engage Maxwell in conversation as she is represented by counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery review; an accused individual in custody at MDC who is to review sensitive discovery materials with her attorney present.

events.title: Maxwell Discovery Review Session
events.description: A scheduled meeting at MDC from 8am to 3pm for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials with her attorney present, facilitated by FBI agents.

events.title: Cancelled Discovery Review
events.description: A previously scheduled meeting for Maxwell's discovery review was cancelled by her attorney, requiring rescheduling.

keyFacts: FBI agents were tasked with bringing a secure laptop to MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell to review discovery materials while in custody.
Maxwell's attorney was required to be present during the review, and the FBI was explicitly instructed not to engage her in any conversation.
The email chain shows logistical coordination and last-minute scheduling changes for legal proceedings in Maxwell's case in October 2020.
